title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about the future, presenting a dystopian world of perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance, and public manipulation.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel of manners, love, and misunderstanding among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment that comes with it, set in the Jazz Age.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel about the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab for revenge on Moby Dick, the white whale.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that intertwines the lives of private and public individuals during the time of the Napoleonic wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J. D. Salinger
description: A novel about the experiences of a young man named Holden Caulfield, who is disillusioned with the adult world.

title: The Hobbit
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic world where society is controlled by technology and conditioning.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about the adventures of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A novel about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of a young man who commits a murder.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A novel about the lives of three brothers and their father, exploring themes of faith, doubt, and morality.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel about the experiences of a young orphaned girl, Jane Eyre, as she grows up and falls in love with Mr. Rochester.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A novel about the intense and destructive love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem about the journey of the soul through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about the events of the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel about the tragic love affair between Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky, set against the backdrop of Russian society.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A novel about the life of Emma Bovary, a doctor's wife who seeks escape from her mundane life through romantic fantasies and affairs.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A novel about the adventures of Edmond Dantès, who is wrongfully imprisoned and seeks revenge on those who betrayed him.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel about the growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A novel about the struggles of ex-convict Jean Valjean and his quest for redemption.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man named Dorian Gray, who remains eternally youthful while his portrait ages and reflects his moral corruption.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A novel about the vampire Count Dracula and his attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel about a young scientist named Victor Frankenstein, who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel about the adventures of a young boy named Huck Finn as he travels down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave named Jim.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A novel about the life of Hester Prynne, who is condemned to wear a scarlet letter 'A' for adultery.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novella about a man named Gregor Samsa, who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A novel about an indifferent French Algerian named Meursault, who is put on trial for the murder of an Arab man.

title: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novel about a man named Josef K., who is arrested and prosecuted by a remote, inaccessible authority, with the nature of his crime revealed to neither him nor the reader.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel about a group of expatriates in Europe after World War I, exploring themes of love, loss, and the search for meaning.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel about an old Cuban fisherman named Santiago, who struggles to catch a giant marlin in the Gulf Stream.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A novel about the Buendía family and the fictional town of Macondo, exploring themes of love, power, and the passage of time.

title: Love in the Time of Cholera
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A novel about the enduring love between Florentino Ariza and Fermina Daza, set against the backdrop of a Caribbean port town.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A novel about the adventures of a man named Don Quixote, who sets out to revive chivalry and bring justice to the world.

author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel about the experiences of a young orphaned girl, Jane Eyre, as she grows up and falls in love with Mr. Rochester.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A novel about the intense and destructive love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem about the journey of the soul through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about the events of the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel about the tragic love affair between Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky, set against the backdrop of Russian society.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A novel about the life of Emma Bovary, a doctor's wife who seeks escape from her mundane life through romantic fantasies and affairs.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A novel about the adventures of Edmond Dantès, who is wrongfully imprisoned and seeks revenge on those who betrayed him.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel about the growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A novel about the struggles of ex-convict Jean Valjean and his quest for redemption.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man named Dorian Gray, who remains eternally youthful while his portrait ages and reflects his moral corruption.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A novel about the vampire Count Dracula and his attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel about a young scientist named Victor Frankenstein, who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel about the adventures of a young boy named Huck Finn as he travels down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave named Jim.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A novel about the life of Hester Prynne, who is condemned to wear a scarlet letter 'A' for adultery.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novella about a man named Gregor Samsa, who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A novel about an indifferent French Algerian named Meursault, who is put on trial for the murder of an Arab man.

title: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novel about a man named Josef K., who is arrested and prosecuted by a remote, inaccessible authority, with the nature of his crime revealed to neither him nor the reader.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel about a group of expatriates in Europe after World War I, exploring themes of love, loss, and the search for meaning.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel about an old Cuban fisherman named Santiago, who struggles to catch a giant marlin in the Gulf Stream.
